othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: configure and manage authentication and login settings

body.context:
The AUTHENTICATION & LOGIN SETTINGS page enables the Administrator to define settings and configurations around logging into the system. Most of these configurations are set before the initial use of . The settings include defining:
Login mode and authentication method
Timeout periods
Password configurations
Login attempts configurations
Login attempt configurations

li.p: In the module menu, click Administration.
Expand System Configurations, and then click Authentication & Login Settings.
The AUTHENTICATION & LOGIN SETTINGS page is displayed.
Provide the required information in the fields, as described in the following table.

row.entry:
Select a login mode from the drop-down list.
The available options are:
Mind: Select this option to login through the user account created in .
For more information on user accounts, refer to .
External IDP: Select this option to login using the third party IDP such as ADFS, BigF5, and so on.
Mixed: Select this option to use both the options – Local and External IDP logins.
The login page is launched based on the login mode you select.
For External IDP or Mixed login modes, select the required authentication method.
Enter the time duration (in hours) after which the reset password link which is sent by email, expires.
Session Time Out notification prior (in seconds)
Enter the time in seconds. The session timeout notification is displayed after the specified time duration prior to the session expiry.

li.p: In the PASSWORD CONFIGURATIONS section, provide the required information in the fields, as described in the following table.

row.entry: Enter the number to define the minimum number of characters required in a password.
Select the check box to define the characteristics of the password.
User ID or part of User ID should not be the part of password

Enter the number of days after which the default password that is set for user accounts created by bulk upload of user account information expires.For information on creating user accounts in bulk, refer to Creating User Accounts in Bulk.
By default, the Never Expire check box is enabled, which means the password never expires.
Send Email Notification prior to password expiry date

entry.note: This field is not available if the Never Expire check box is selected.
entry.p: Select the check box to send email reminders to users everyday prior to password expiration date.

row.entry: User Must Change the Password at First Logon
Select the check box to notify the users to change the password at first logon.
Alternatively, clear the check box to continue using the password as set when the account is created.

entry.note: This field is displayed if the Send Email Notification Prior to Password Expiry Date check box is selected.
entry.p: Enter how many days prior to the expiry date the reminder should be sent to the users.

entry.note: This field is displayed if the Send Email Notification Prior to Password Expiry Date check box is selected.
entry.p: Select the appropriate mail body template to send a standard automated email notification to the users with password expiration details. ​
Available options are templates defined in the Mail Body Templates catalog of the Library.
For more information on defining mail body templates, refer to .

row.entry: By default, the Not Defined check box is selected.
To enforce password history, remove the check box and enter the number of unique new passwords that must be associated with a user account before an old password can be reused.

li.p: In the LOGIN ATTEMPTS CONFIGURATIONS section, provide the required information in the fields, as described in the following table.

entry.p: Enter the value to set the maximum number of unsuccessful login attempts that will cause a user account to be locked.

row.entry: Reset unsuccessful Login attempt counter (in mins)

By default, the counter is set to 60 minutes.
Enter the value to define the number of minutes that must pass to reset the account that is locked due to maximum number of unsuccessful login attempts.

li.p: The EXTERNAL IDP CONFIGURATIONS section is for capturing information of AzureAD integration.

p.note: Do not enter information in these fields. An integration is setup with ADFS and not with AzureAD. The details of this integration are not configurable by Administrators. Please consult Mind to make changes to the ADFS integration.
